ANU.name: Kath Hall
interest: Foreign Bribery Laws; Transnational Anti-Corruption Regulation; Psychology and Corruption; Private Sector Whistleblowing; Globalisation of the Legal Profession; Student Wellbeing
ANU.biography: Previously Kath has held positions as the Director (Law) of the Transnational Research Centre on Corruption (ANU) and the chair of the International Bar Association Drivers of Corruption Sub-Committee. She has been a lead investigator on large Australian Research Council (ARC0 Projects on Whistleblowing and has published extensively in the areas of corporate law, corporate social responsibility, statutory interpretation and student wellbeing. Her doctoral research was on psychology and corporate misconduct.
